author: Sally Peck
title: October half-term sun: where to find the best deals
text:
Comments 
October half term is one of the trickiest periods for which to book a holiday. The term is long and tiring for children; long-haul trips in 10 days may be too ambitious. It is also a difficult time of year to find reliably good weather in short-haul destinations; southern parts of Europe offer excellent value at this time of year, but sunshine is not guaranteed. 
This year, most half-term holidays start on Friday, October 23. Prices in the following week will increase slightly in destinations popular with Britons. They may drop if they don’t get enough bookings, but waiting is risky. 
Here is our roundup of the best sunny destinations for this October half term, along with our favourite tour operators that specialise in each area. For further advice, including recommended hotels, resorts, sights and restaurants, see the link to our expert destination guides. Cyprus 
Flight time 4.5 hours 
Weather 21-25C 
Outside of the August peak, Cyprus offers reasonable prices and has perhaps the mildest climate in the entire Mediterranean, making it a great option for families. 
Cyprus offers the mildest climate of the Mediterranean Photo: Alamy 
Sunvil (020 8758 4759; sunvil.co.uk ) is offering seven nights B&B for two adults and two children (under 12) at the five-star Four Seasons Hotel, Limassol, including return flights from Luton airport from £5,969.37, departing October 24. Our Cyprus expert gives the hotel 9/10 stars, praising it for being “one of the top half-dozen hotels on the island owing to service standards, room appointments and good food”. Plus, there’s a year-round supervised kindergarten (ages 3-8), and a children’s club (ages 7-13) during school holidays.
